author: Staff Reporter
text:
The special camp series that began in Kancheepuram district on Friday to help unemployed youth in flood-affected areas to take up business or manufacturing under the subsidy linked loan scheme — Unemployed Youth Employment Generation Programme (UYEGP) — has received an encouraging response, officials said.

More than 250 youth from Kancheepuram, Sriperumpudur and Wallajahbad taluks attended and applied for financial assistance under UYEGP special camp held at the District Industries Centre.

Concession for youth

Officials said the State government had recently directed the District Industries Centres in the districts to conduct special camps under UYEGP with a concession that youth from flood-affected areas need not have to undergo the mandatory training programme to make them eligible for financial assistance.

However, except for exclusion of training module, other eligibility criteria like educational qualification of a pass in class XII and annual family income of less than Rs.1.50 lakhs remains the same, officials said.

Special camp

The special camp for youth in Alandur and Tambaram taluks will be held on Monday, for Tirupporur and Sholinganallur taluks on Wednesday, for Chengalpattu and Tirukazhukundram taluks on Thursday and for Madurantakam, Cheyyur and Uthiramerur taluks on Friday.

For further details, 2723 8837.

Over 250 youth applied for financial assistance under UYEGP
title: Good response for scheme to help youth from flood-hit areas
